content.question: Let the random variable <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of people living in a household in a certain town. The standard deviation of <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is 1.8. Which of the following statements is the best interpretation of the standard deviation?

choices.label: The number of people living in a randomly selected household is expected to be 1.8 people.
The number of people living in a randomly selected household will be 1.8 people away from the mean.
On average, the number of people living in a household varies from the mean by about 1.8 people.
For a random sample of households, the average number of people per household is expected to be 1.8 people.
For a random sample of households, the average number of people per household will be 1.8 people away from the mean.

content.answer: On average, the number of people living in a household varies from the mean by about 1.8 people.
